testInfo.name: Gesamtfragenkatalog zum Test „Leben in Deutschland“ und zum „Einbürgerungstest“

questions.germanQuestion: Welches Wappen gehört zur Freien und Hansestadt Hamburg?
questions.englishQuestion: Which coat of arms belongs to the Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg?

nouns.english: Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg

questions.notes: The coat of arms of Hamburg typically features a castle with three towers, symbolizing the city's historical significance as a fortified settlement.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with Hamburg's coat of arms, which prominently features a castle emblem.

resources.description: Learn more about the coat of arms of Hamburg.

questions.germanQuestion: Welches ist ein Bezirk von Hamburg?
questions.englishQuestion: Which is a district (Bezirk) of Hamburg?
questions.notes: Altona is one of the seven districts (Bezirke) of Hamburg, located in the western part of the city.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the districts of Hamburg, especially Altona, which has a rich history as a former Danish town.

resources.description: Learn more about the districts of Hamburg.

questions.germanQuestion: Für wie viele Jahre wird das Landesparlament in Hamburg gewählt?
questions.englishQuestion: For how many years is the state parliament in Hamburg elected?
questions.notes: The state parliament in Hamburg is elected for a term of 5 years.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the term length for the Hamburg state parliament is 5 years, similar to many other German states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political system in Hamburg.

questions.germanQuestion: Ab welchem Alter darf man in Hamburg bei Kommunalwahlen (Wahl der Bezirksversammlungen) wählen?
questions.englishQuestion: At what age can you vote in local elections (election of the district assemblies) in Hamburg?
questions.notes: In Hamburg, citizens can participate in local elections starting at the age of 16.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that 16 is the voting age for local elections in Hamburg, similar to other German city-states.

resources.description: Learn more about voting rights in Hamburg.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Farben hat die Landesflagge von Hamburg?
questions.englishQuestion: What are the colors of the state flag of Hamburg?
questions.notes: The state flag of Hamburg consists of the colors white and red, featuring a castle with three towers.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember the white and red colors of Hamburg's flag, which symbolize the city's historic significance as a fortified settlement.

resources.description: Learn more about the flag of Hamburg.

questions.germanQuestion: Wo können Sie sich in Hamburg über politische Themen informieren?
questions.englishQuestion: Where can you get information on political topics in Hamburg?

options.germanOption: bei der Landeszentrale für politische Bildung
options.englishOption: at the State Center for Civic Education

questions.notes: In Hamburg, the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' (State Center for Civic Education) is the primary resource for information on political topics.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on the role of the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' in educating the public about political matters in Hamburg.

resources.description: Learn more about the State Center for Civic Education in Hamburg.

questions.englishQuestion: Which federal state is a city-state?
questions.notes: Hamburg is one of the three city-states in Germany, alongside Berlin and Bremen. These are both cities and federal states.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that Hamburg, Berlin, and Bremen are the city-states ('Stadtstaaten') of Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about the city-states of Germany.

questions.notes: Hamburg is located in northern Germany and is one of the country's three city-states.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with Hamburg's location as a city-state in northern Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about Hamburg's geographical and political status.

questions.germanQuestion: Wie nennt man die Regierungschefin/den Regierungschef des Stadtstaates Hamburg?
questions.englishQuestion: What is the title of the head of government in the city-state of Hamburg?
questions.notes: The head of government in Hamburg is called the 'Erste Bürgermeisterin' or 'Erster Bürgermeister,' which translates to 'First Mayor.'
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the title 'First Mayor' is used in Hamburg, one of Germany's city-states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political structure of Hamburg.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Senatorin/welchen Senator hat Hamburg nicht?
questions.englishQuestion: Which senator does Hamburg not have?
questions.notes: Hamburg, like other German states, does not have a Senator for Foreign Relations ('Senator für Außenbeziehungen'), as foreign policy is managed at the federal level.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that foreign relations are handled by the federal government in Germany, not by individual states like Hamburg.

resources.description: Learn more about the political structure of Hamburg.
